You meet somebody that you've never met before, and you talk to them for a little while, and you can find out their likes, their dislikes, their loves. You can find out their interests. Why? Because they talk about what they love. You ever meet somebody that's all about cars? They're talking about cars, and they're just, I didn't look at you, Ron, for that purpose. Sorry. But you're looking, and you're just talking about, but it's, they, we understand it. But I wonder this evening, how often when we as God's people just kind of are having fellowship, how often do we talk about God's Word? Like, just naturally. Just when's the last time you said to someone, or maybe someone said to you, hey, what's God teaching you from His Word? And the fact that we wouldn't be fearful of someone asking us that question, that we are spending so much time in God's Word, that daily we're in the Bible because we love it. We say, oh, how love I thy law, that I'm not afraid of someone asking me, hey, what's God teaching you in His, from His Word? What did you read today? What are you studying? What are you learning? What is God revealing? We shouldn't have to be afraid of that question if we love God's Word. This evening I would submit to you, as Bible-believing Christians, that we ought to echo the words of the psalmist and say, oh, how love I thy law. But there ought to be evidences in our lives that would support the claim. Really, you say that you love God's Word? Does the evidence support it? We're to inspect and examine ourselves, not someone else. We'll examine our own hearts. How's my Bible reading? As you think about that this evening, just ask yourself, how's my Bible reading? I've told you before, there's times that I go to read my Bible and I'm distracted. You say, oh, you're the pastor. I'm a human being. There are times I go to read my Bible and I'm distracted. I'll read a chapter, two, maybe three, and I'm like, I have no idea what I just read. I'm distracted. So you know what I do? I've told you before, from this pulpit what I do. I go back and I start over and I pray, God, help me to not be distracted. Eliminate those distractions. Help me to be focused. Why? Because this is your Word and you have something for me. And I want to get what you have for me because I need it. We come to the place where we say, listen, how's my Bible reading? When's the last time I shared something from God's Word with someone else? I mean, not forced to, but just because it's got to come out, it's the overflow. Like it's just, I want to talk about it. And that's why I see the psalmist, oh, how love I thy law. I hope this evening that each of us would say, I love God's Word. And then we'd examine ourselves and see if the evidence supports the claim. Let's pray. Father, we love you. Thank you for loving us. It's a joy to have the Bible. It's a joy this evening to know that you've given us the opportunity to put together scriptures, John and Romans, these last couple of days. It's a labor of love. It's a labor. Because we know the power of Your Word. We know that it's profitable. Being born again not of corruptible seed but of incorruptible by the Word of God which liveth and abideth forever. God, I pray that You would help us to love Your Word. And I pray that the evidences would be in our lives that as we examine ourselves, Lord, You'd help us to read and study and memorize and meditate and share Your Word. Help it to be fresh. Lord, give us revival. I pray that You'd move and work in hearts and lives as only You can and we'll thank You for it in Christ's name we pray. Would You stand with us?

While I was in Bible college, there was a, I think it was only one or two years that
I was there that they had it, but they had an old style camp meeting. It was a thing
called Camp Glory, Camp Glory. And Holly, when she was younger, her church would come
over and participate in that. It was, put a big tent out and had this Camp Glory. And
I remember all the sound equipment would be under there. And so as a college student,
they asked some of us on one of the evenings if we'd sleep under the tent so that there'd
be some people there to protect all of the valuable equipment with all the sound equipment
and what have you. And I remember at the time, Holly and I weren't married, I was in college,
but some of her brothers and myself and a couple of other college students, we slept
under the tent that night. And for a couple of hours, we just quoted scripture. And here's
how we do it. There's like six of us and they'd have to memorize and quote, rehearse
a verse. And then the next person, the next person, the next person, the next person,
just kind of go right in a circle. And just how many verses could we quote? How many verses
had we hid in our hearts? And you'd be laying there and you've already quoted five, six,
seven, however many verses. And you're trying to think of the next one you're going to say.
And then two people before you said it and you said, no, that was the one I was going
to say. Right. And you're trying to think about the verses, but, but hiding God's word
